column4: hi all, i installed ubuntu on my labtop, then i installed it on another pc, i want to copy the version on my labtop to the new 1, i thouth to copy all files from the old to the new but i dont know i that will wotk !
You should copy everything in your /home
It is likely that is the only place that is different between the two.
no i installed a lot of softs on the old one
Then you need to copy all of /usr and all of your home folder
Umm, I've never tried it.  Now that I think about it, that will probably freak out the package manager.
You could copy the entire install to the new machine.  (they won't remain syncronized)
Connect both of the hdd's to the same computer some how.
boot that computer with a live CD, use gparted to copy the partition from one hdd to another, install grup.  Fix any small bugs that might be left over
how about users account and theire passwords?
Well if you copy the entire system that will be taken care of
If you copy individual folder and files and stuff then you'll need that to.  The more I think about it though copying this way is a bad idea
It will take a long time.  Have fun!
